children.text:
I-85 Atlanta, Georgia Overpass Closure:

A major fire underneath the I-85 overpass in Atlanta caused a section of the roadway to collapse between I-75 and GA 400. All lanes of I-85 North and South are currently closed from the downtown connector to GA 400. The GA Department of Public Safety is requesting that motorists avoid that area.
 
•	I-85 is closed from I-75/Brookwood split to the North Druid Hills Exit (Exit 89).
•	Motorists traveling northbound on I-85 from the southside of Atlanta will be diverted to northbound I-75 at Brookwood near 17th Street
•	Motorists traveling southbound on I-85 north of Atlanta will be diverted to northbound GA 400
•	Motorists traveling southbound on GA 400 from north of Atlanta will be diverted to northbound I-85
•	Motorists are encouraged to utilize their favorite wayfinding app to help navigate to their destinations
 
Lanes are expected to remain closed indefinitely. For more information please call 511 or visit www.511ga.org
 

LA 1 Intracoastal Bridge Weight Restrictions:

Effective immediately, the LA Department of Transportation is lowering the load limit permitted for vehicles traveling on the LA 1 Intracoastal Waterway Bridge. The new posting is 15 – 25 tons for vehicle traveling in both directions, until bridge repairs are made.

LA State Police will be assisting with the load restriction changes. Weight Enforcement Officers will be stationed near the bridge to help monitor traffic and enforce the new weight limits. Officers will stop and detour commercial motor vehicles that exceed those weight requirements.
